required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Satisfaction Study of BOTOX® Cosmetic in the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Frown Lines
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study of BOTOX® Cosmetic in the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Glabellar Lines - Establishing Patient Satisfaction

brief_summary.textblock: This was a pilot study to observe patient satisfaction with BOTOX® Cosmetic treatment in glabellar rhytides (frown lines) using a new treatment satisfaction measure.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Improvement in Subject Global Assessment of Change at Day 30
primary_outcome.description: Subjects assessed the improvement of their glabellar lines (area between the eyebrows) by answering the question: Compared to before receiving the study treatment, How do you currently feel about the appearance of your glabellar lines? on a 7-point scale where 0=Very much improved, 1=Much improved, 2=Minimally improved, 3=No change, 4=Minimally worse, 5=Much worse, 6=Very much worse. Improvement was defined as responses: 0=Very much improved, 1=Much improved and 2=Minimally improved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Facial Wrinkle Scale Responders at Maximum Attempted Muscle Contraction at Day 30
secondary_outcome.description: The Investigator rated the subject's severity of glabellar lines (between the eyebrows) at maximum attempted muscle contraction using the 4-point Facial Wrinkle scale where 0=None (Best), 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe (Worse) at day 30. Responders were defined as participants with a score of 0=None or 1=Mild.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Facial Wrinkle Scale Responders at Maximum Attempted Muscle Contraction at Day 60
secondary_outcome.description: The Investigator rated the subject's severity of glabellar lines (between the eyebrows) at maximum attempted muscle contraction using the 4-point Facial Wrinkle scale where 0=None (Best), 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe (Worse) at day 60. Responders were defined as participants with a score of 0=None or 1=Mild.

arm_group.description: Botulinum toxin Type A 20U (total dose) injected into the glabellar region on Day 0.
Normal Saline (placebo) injected into the glabellar region on Day 0.

intervention.description: botulinum toxin Type A 20U (total dose) injected into the glabellar region on Day 0.
Normal saline (placebo) injected into the glabellar region on Day 0.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Moderate to severe glabellar wrinkles (frown lines)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous treatment with botulinum toxin therapy of any serotype
- Facial non-ablative resurfacing laser or light treatment, microdermabrasion, or superficial peels within 3 months
- Any facial cosmetic procedure with medium depth to deep facial chemical peels (e.g., trichloroacetic acid and phenol), mid-facial or periorbital laser skin resurfacing or permanent make-up within 6 months
- Mid-facial or periorbital treatment with non-permanent soft tissue fillers
- Subjects planning a facial cosmetic procedure or visible scars
- Previous cosmetic surgery to the upper face(e.g., prior periorbital surgery, facial lift, brow lift, eyelid lift or eyebrow surgery)
- Diagnoses of Myasthenia Gravis, Eaton-Lambert Syndrome, Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
- History of facial nerve palsy
- A planned extended absence during the study

reported_events.desc: Serious adverse events and adverse events were assessed in all participants with at least 1 post-baseline assessment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
